metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8396 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the ImageRegionReader::ReadIntoBuffer function in MediaStorageAndFileFormat/gdcmImageRegionReader.cxx in Grassroots DICOM (aka GDCM) before 2.6.2 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted header dimensions in a DICOM image file, which triggers a buffer overflow. It was discovered that GDCM incorrectly handled certain DICOM image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgdcm-cil - 2.6.2-2
libgdcm-tools - 2.6.2-2
libgdcm2.6 - 2.6.2-2
libvtkgdcm-cil - 2.6.2-2
libvtkgdcm-tools - 2.6.2-2
libvtkgdcm2.6 - 2.6.2-2
php5-gdcm - 2.6.2-2
php5-vtkgdcm - 2.6.2-2
python-gdcm - 2.6.2-2
python-vtkgdcm - 2.6.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdcm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.2-2').
